channel.title: What should i take as my options?
channel.description:
Apprently, i need to start thinking about my options..
I want to do ICT and music.
May take french
i think im gonig to drop Geo and History.
Apprently, now you have to do RE, meh plan to fail that as i don't goto the lessons.
English Maths Science Have to take lol
Well i would like to know your options and why :)

item.title: What should i take as my options?
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

You lucky people.

Only option I had was Psychology / Physics (and even though I chose Physics I had to take Psychology anyway, because not enough students subscribed).

item.title: What should i take as my options?
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I took,

[ul][li]Construction Crafts[/li]
[li]Graphic Communication[/li]
[li]Art and Design[/li]
[li]Chemistry[/li]
[li]Physical Education[/li][/ul]

Typed everything out 'cause I had trouble remembering.

CC gets you out of modern languages, and it’s really good. Lecturers come out from local college(s) and teach you techniques and such in specific crafts (Bricklaying, electricity, plumbing, joinery and painting and decorating).

Graphics is alright, it’s about drawing objects from different views on both paper and computers. It’s also about colours, everything graphical basically.

Art’s pretty much self-explanatory, Chemistry is too, it’s intresting.

P.E is alright, at my school you do football, badminton and basketball as the main three courses (Over 1 year). Each year you’re taught different techniques, it’s harder.

Read full topic

item.source: What should i take as my options?

item.title: What should i take as my options?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I took:

DIDA - Diploma in Digital Applications (It’s a load of shit but I’ll get good marks and it’ll look good)
History
English
Science - Seperate sciences - Have to take 3 different lessons for Chemistry, Physics and Biology… you should take this is good.
Maths
PE - I started off doing the full theory course with some practical… but it’s fucking shit. So i dropped down to core which is pretty much all practical ;).
Citizenship - You can get an A* without going to one lesson. It’s pretty much English with a main subject.
RE - Same as above…

I can’t wait till 6th form then Uni… right now GCSEs are ghey!

Read full topic
